article_title: Don’t Believe the ‘Use By’ Date, Food Safety Tips – AARP
article_text: Meet Age-Defying People Doing Incredible Things — and Disrupting Aging! Read Their Stories

twitter.description: Do you throw out food when it’s past the “use by” or “sell by” date on the label, thinking it’s no longer safe to eat? Then you’re making the same mistake that 91 percent of Americans – myself included – make: namely, prematurely tossing billions of pounds of food (and wasting lots of money) every year because we think those dates indicate food safety. In actuality, the dates stamped on food products are set by manufacturers primarily to help retailers …
twitter.creator: @aarp
twitter.title: Food Labels: Don’t Believe the ‘Use By’ Date

article_metadata.keywords: food safety, food product labels, use by dates, expiration dates, candy sagon, usda, optimal foods quality
article_metadata.title: Food Labels: Don’t Believe the ‘Use By’ Date
article_metadata.description: Dates on food products are set primarily to help retailers rotate inventory or to indicate peak quality for taste. Dates have nothing to do with food safety.
